The “UI” in UI design stands for “user interface.” The user interface is the graphical layout of an application.

It consists of the buttons users click on, the text they read, the images, sliders, text entry fields, and all the rest of the items the user interacts with.

This includes screen layout, transitions, interface animations and every single micro-interaction.

They’re concerned with aesthetics. It’s up to them to make sure the application’s interface is attractive, visually-stimulating and themed appropriately to match the purpose and/or personality of the app.

And they need to make sure every single visual element feels united, both aesthetically, and in purpose.
